data.title: CMWHS — THE OAKTREE FAMILY MEDICAL CENTRE
data.text:
CoalBoard Medical

Booking and Information Guide

Registered spirometry practice

Registration number P0005540

** If you are unable to complete you Reshealth prior to your medical appointment time, we are unable to access this due to the way the system works. Any medicals cancelled/rescheduled on the day due to Reshealth not being completed prior will incur full fee for the medical. **

**If you need a copy of your Coal Board Medical examination results for a new employer or for any other reason, you can request a copy through the Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy's Resources Safety and Health Queensland (RSHQ) website. The RSHQ website provides information on how to request copies of your Coal Board Medical examination results, including the forms you need to fill out and submit. You should plan ahead and allow sufficient time for your request to be processed before you need the results. https://www.business.qld.gov.au/industries/mining-energy-water/resources/safety-health/mining/medicals/coal-workers-health/copies

RESHEALTH - What is it?

Reshealth is a government-designed and operated online platform used for booking Coal Board Medical examinations in Queensland, Australia. It is designed to facilitate the process of scheduling medical examinations for coal mine workers and to streamline the administrative tasks associated with managing the results of the examination.

Reshealth is managed by the Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy's Resources Safety and Health Queensland (RSHQ). The platform allows employers to select an accredited medical practitioner to conduct the examination. It also facilitates the transfer of examination results to the appropriate parties, such as the worker's employer(Section 4 only) or regulatory bodies.

https://www.rshq.qld.gov.au/reshealth/employers

How do I start using ResHealth?

You will need to nominate a super user who will register your company and themselves at the same time. The super user will need to verify their identity. This person will be the administrator for ResHealth and control who can access ResHealth on your company’s behalf.

How do I initiate a health assessment?

Once you or another employee representative are registered in ResHealth you can start a health assessment. You will need the following information to start this process:

Employee email address

Date of Birth

Full legal name

Contact phone number.

Description for Workers:

Coal mine workers in Queensland are required to undergo a Coal Board Medical examination to assess their fitness for work in a coal mine. Some general requirements for workers to meet for the Coal Board Medical examination include:

Scheduling the Examination: Workers must schedule the Coal Board Medical examination with a qualified medical practitioner who is accredited to conduct the examination - EMO’S registered via the RSHQ website.

Providing medical history: Workers must provide a detailed medical history to the medical practitioner, including information about any pre-existing medical conditions, surgeries, and medications.

Attending the examination: Workers must attend the Coal Board Medical examination and complete all necessary tests and assessments.

Providing proof of immunizations: Workers must provide proof of immunization for certain diseases, such as hepatitis B.

Disclosure of current medical conditions: Workers must disclose any current medical conditions or injuries that may impact their ability to perform their job duties safely.

Complying with drug and alcohol testing: Workers must comply with drug and alcohol testing as part of the Coal Board Medical examination to assess their fitness for work in a safety-critical industry.

It is important for workers to ensure they meet all necessary requirements for the Coal Board Medical examination to ensure they are fit to work safely in a coal mine. Workers should consult with their employer and the medical practitioner conducting the examination to ensure they have met all requirements.
